{{Marvel Database:Team Template | Image = X-Club Vol 1 1 Textless.jpg | ImageSize = 300px | Name = X-Club | Aliases = The X-Men's Science Team,{{r|Uncanny X-Men #519}} "The Center of Mutantkind's scientific endeavors"{{r|Weapon X Vol 3 11}} | Status = Active | Identity = Secret | Reality = Earth-616 | BaseOfOperations = [[Costa Rica]]; formerly [[Utopia (X-Men Base)|Utopia]], [[San Francisco Bay]], [[California (State)|California]]; [[Graymalkin Industries]], Marin Headlands, [[San Francisco]], California | Leaders = Formerly [[James Bradley (Earth-616)|Dr. Nemesis]] | CurrentMembers = [[Madison Jeffries (Earth-616)|Madison Jeffries]], [[Kavita Rao (Earth-616)|Dr. Kavita Rao]] | FormerMembers = [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Angel]], [[Henry McCoy (Earth-616)|Beast]], [[Danger (Earth-616)|Danger]], [[Elizabeth Braddock (Earth-616)|Psylocke]], [[Yuriko Takiguchi (Earth-616)|Dr. Yuriko Takiguchi]] | Allies = [[Max Eisenhardt (Earth-616)|Magneto]], [[David Alleyne (Earth-616)|Prodigy]],
[[X-Force (Strike Team) (Earth-616)|X-Force]], [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]] | Enemies = [[Hellfire Club (Earth-616)|Hellfire Club]] & [[Sentinels|Sentinel]] (1906);
[[Human Council (Earth-616)|Human Council]], [[Bastion (Earth-616)|Bastion]] & [[Graydon Creed (Earth-616)|Graydon Creed]] | Origin = Gathered by the [[Henry McCoy (Earth-616)|Beast]] to solve the scientific issues of the day (and generally [[M-Day]]) | PlaceOfFormation = [[Graymalkin Industries]], Marin Highlands, [[San Francisco]], [[California (State)|California]] | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = Matt Fraction; Terry Dodson | First = Uncanny X-Men #507 | HistoryText = ===Creation=== In order to save [[Homo superior|mutantkind]] from the effects of [[Decimation|M-Day]], [[Henry McCoy (Earth-616)|Beast]] and [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Angel]] had to gather a team of specialists to help them. They gathered [[James Bradley (Earth-616)|Dr. Nemesis (James Bradley)]],{{r|Uncanny X-Men #504}} [[Madison Jeffries (Earth-616)|Box (Madison Jeffries)]],{{r|Uncanny X-Men #505}} and [[Yuriko Takiguchi (Earth-616)|Dr. Yuriko Takiguchi]].{{r|Uncanny X-Men #506}} After having defeated the [[Godzilla (Earth-616)|Leviathan]] Takiguchi had activated believing the newcomers to be Russians, the pack returned to [[Graymalkin Industries]] to meet their final member, [[Kavita Rao (Earth-616)|Dr. Kavita Rao]], who was formerly trying to cure mutation.{{r|Uncanny X-Men #507}} Together, they tried to figure what can turn the [[X-Gene]] back on in the depowered mutants. Nemesis brought up pre-mutant DNA from his parents as an example.{{r|Uncanny X-Men #512}} They also assembled a time travel device to help them locate [[Nathan Summers (Earth-616)|Cable]] and the [[Hope Summers (Earth-616)|Mutant Messiah]] in the far future. However, the devices were only prototypes, brought together in a short time. The side effects included biological acceleration so therefore the travelers would have to return to the present in thirty three and a half hours.{{r|X-Force Vol 3 12}} ===Utopia=== The X-Club went down two members, as Dr. Takiguchi died on Utopia of natural causes,{{r|Uncanny X-Men #515}} and Beast left the X-Men, grown disillusioned with how Cyclops was leading what remained of the mutant race.{{r|Uncanny X-Men #519}} ===Reformation=== Eventually, the X-Club reassembled, composed then of Kavita Rao and Madison Jeffries. They provided [[James Howlett (Earth-21923)|Logan]] with a cell to lock down [[Aliana Alba (Earth-616)|Dr. Alba]].{{r|Weapon X Vol 3 11}} | Equipment = [[Ghost boxes|Ghost Box]] | Transportation = | Weapons = | Notes = | Trivia = | Links = }} [[Category:Think Tanks]]
